signin.title: Sign in to your account
signin.2faDesc:
Open the two-factor authentication app on your device to view your authentication code and verify your identity.
You can also use your backup code.
signin.notAMember: Not a member? <url>Start a {{amount}} day free trial</url>

signup.tos: I do accept <tos>Terms and Conditions</tos> and the <pp>Privacy Policy</pp>.

common.xCharsError: The password has to consist of at least {{amount}} characters.
common.passwordTooLong: The provided password is too long, maximum length is {{amount}} characters
common.tosError: You have to accept our TOS and privacy policy in order to use our services.
common.checkLeakedPasswordDesc: When enabled we check your password with the <db>{{database}}</db> database. We don't send your password to the service. First we hash your password (using SHA1) and send only the first 5 characters of that hash to the service. The service returns all leaked passwords that start with those 5 characters. At our end we check if one of these matches with your password. We show you a warning if it has been leaked before. We never store your password in plain text.

notFoundPage.title: Page not found
notFoundPage.description:
Sorry, we couldn’t find the page you’re looking for.
Please check the URL in the address bar and try again.

contact.desc:
Have something to ask?
Feel free to drop us an email at <mail>{{email}}</mail>

beta.title: Beta
beta.description: This feature is in the Beta phase. Use it with caution as there may be side effects.

checklist.desc:
Swetrix Marketplace is a platform for sharing high-quality extensions that are easy to use by anyone.
In order to ensure that extensions are free from security vulnerabilities, our team reviews all extensions before they're listed publicly.
Once you've tested your extension, make sure that it meets the entire checklist below before submitting.

list.title: The extension is secure without use of external scripts.
list.desc: Because extensions are run in Swetrix production with full access to the browser, we carefully review extensions for potential vulnerabilities. Use of external scripts is strongly discouraged and may be rejected as consequence. Make sure to remove external scripts and review your extension for potential vulnerabilities.

list.title: Code is unminified and formatted consistently.
list.desc: In order for our team to be able to conduct a security review of your extension, its source code must be submitted in an unminified and unobfuscated form. Extensions with consistent code formatting reduce the time from submission to approval. Generally, all JavaScript code styles are permitted as long as they're consistent and human readable.

list.title: Tested on multiple browsers and different websites.
list.desc: We recommend testing extensions for the last 2 versions of Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge, and IE 11. If your extension is visual, make sure that it's mobile friendly.

list.title: Extension icons and screenshots are uploaded.
list.desc:
Extension developers/designers get to submit a range of media to show off your extension.
It is required that every extension have an icon.
Finally you can add gallery images to show off your extension in action. While not required, we encourage all extensions to add these screenshots to illustrate what the extension looks like and behaves on a real example dashboard.
We recommend to add at least 1 screenshot which demonstrates the extension in action.
